lines.text: I did not spend six years in junior college to be a maid.
You're a spoiled, silly, boring, insignificant little twit.
Hey! Who are you calling boring?
Please let me take it in Maria. Please!
She told me to take it in.
Well what difference does it make?
The difference is if you screw up, then my ass is grass and she's the lawnmower!
[Jessie brings Stan his laundry]
What the... WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO MY WRINKLED SUIT?
I pressed it.

I know, but you're not supposed to press it! It's a wrinkled suit! I BOUGHT it wrinkled! It's a Georgio Armani WRINKLE! Wrinkles are IN! It's the 80's, kiddo; wake up! I can't believe this! My Georgio Armani, PRESSED!

[after being arrested for driving under the influence AND carrying drugs, AND trying to bribe the cops who took her in, Jessie is sharing a cell with a hooker who's loudly filing her nails]
... Would you mind not doing that? I'm kinda bummed and I have a headache.
And what are you in for?
I don't remember.
Figures.
God, when this hits the papers... my poor father... He's a philanthropist.
Is he serving time too?
No a philanthropist is... Never mind. So what are YOU in for?

[sarcastic]
... Jaywalking.
Hey, I bruise easily, okay!
You're a real peach, aren't ya?
You're a witch!
I'm perfectly harmless!
That's what they said about asbestos!
But, Dad, please! I'm zeroed out.
I gave you $200.00.
Well, it's ancient history!
I believe it was lunch time.
I never thought I'd hear myself say something like this, Woodrow.
[Looks up at the stars]
I wish I'd never had a daughter.

[at the door of Jessie's jail cell]
Rise and shine, doll.
Who are you?
I'm your fairy godmother.
The nightmare continues...!
Some fairy godmother you are! I thought you guys were supposed to turn maids into princesses, and shit like that.
Some maids deserve to be princesses. Some princesses deserve to be maids.
Please wait! Help me! I... I don't want to be poor. I don't want to be boring. I don't want to be alone. Help me, fairy godmother, please!
